=You are an expert job-role classifier. Given a job description, output the single most relevant **department name**.  
Return **only** the department name as plain text—no extra words, punctuation, or line breaks.  
Use Title Case exactly as shown in the canonical list; never invent variants (e.g., use “Human Resources” not “HR”).  

If none of the listed departments fit, create a concise, Title-Case department name of ≤3 words that best groups the role; reuse that exact name for any future similar roles.  
Only output **FAILED** when the input is empty or contains no discernible job information.

**Canonical Departments**

- Accounting  
- Administration  
- Business Development  
- Customer Support  
- Data Science  
- Design  
- Engineering  
- Finance  
- Human Resources  
- Information Technology

- Marketing

- Project Management  
- Public Relations  
- Quality Assurance  
- Research and Development  
- Sales  
- Security  
- Supply Chain  
- Training  

**Examples**

- *Input*: “Design and optimise user journeys for our mobile app.”  
  *Output*: Design  

- *Input*: “Oversee quarterly financial statements and ensure GAAP compliance.”  
  *Output*: Accounting  

- *Input*: “ ”  
  *Output*: FAILED  

Now classify the role.

json.description: At Ferrovial in Innovation Growth Department. I'm focused on creating more sources of revenue for Ferrovial linked to the core from existing internal and external future developments, establishing partnerships to jointly go to market, and creating new business lines for Ferrovial.

json.position: Head and Professor of Digital Construction
json.location: Madrid, Community of Madrid, Spain · On-site
json.description: At Nebrija University, I am applying my experience in areas such as artificial intelligence, the internet of things, the cloud, 3D printing, and mixed, virtual or augmented reality in the Architecture Department so that students can enter the job market with knowledge in all these digital technologies applied to the world of Construction.

json.position: Chief Innovation Officer (CIO) & Digital Product Development Director
json.description:
•	Develop New Digital Products with our own IP based on technologies like Cloud, Internet of Things, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence and Electronic Security Systems.
•	Strategic partnerships: Alliances to co-innovate (Microsoft)

•	Create GenzAI Platform, a Global Edge-Cloud Platform that connects all our managed devices with IoT, stores all the data and applies Artificial Intelligence to increase efficiency at our Control Centers. Foundation of New Products.
•	Implement Open Innovation strategy connecting with startup ecosystem and empowering our employees’ ideas. 
•	Obtain funding to support our Innovation and Digital Transformation Programs from the European Investment Bank (57,7M€) and tax credits (3,5M€/yr)

json.position: Director of Acciona's Advanced and Digital Innovation Hub
json.description:
•	Digital Innovation Projects developed by six Skill Centers:  3D Printing, Mixed Reality, AI and Robotics, Data Science (Big Data & Analytics), Connected Things and Blockchain & New Tech.
•	New Business line of Large-Scale 3D printing in Dubai
•	First 3d Printed Foot Bridge in the World (Alcobendas).
•	New Business lines creation from technologies developed within ACCIONA. Transferring technology internally and externally (ACCIONA clients). Intellectual Property management.

•	Business launch of products from Tech Innovation Center.
•	Management of advanced technological projects: 8 R&D  projects managed and funded by CDTI and FP7 (Europe)
•	8 Scientific journals publications & 7 patents as inventor

•	Site Work General Manager of "Extension Works of 11th Metro Line from Pan Bendito to Carabanchel Alto" 103,3M€
•	Site Work General Manager of "Extension Works of Airfield of Torrejon Air Military Base and other complementary works" Project for client AENA. Budget: 61,5M€.
•	Site Work Production Manager. Bridges Department during the construction of Radial 2 Highway for client HENARSA (Autopistas del Henares S.A.). Budget: 246,5M€
•	Site Work Technical Manager at "Underground Hydroelectrical Central of Millares II" Project for client IBERDROLA. Budget: 15,2M€.

json.description: ¡Hola! Mi nombre es Daniel García y soy un padre de una niña maravillosa, llamada Lucía que debutó a los 10 años con diabetes 1. Estos meses desde que ha debutado ha sido una continua búsqueda de medidas que pudieran hacerle la vida más fácil. Muchas de esas medidas han venido de la mano de la Tecnología y por ello, como creo que el mundo avanza cuando compartes, he decidido crear el Blog Digital Diabetes (www.digital-diabetes.com) para compartir con todos vosotros los descubrimientos y logros que he ido alcanzando para hacer la vida más fácil de mi hija Lucía gracias a la Tecnología.
json.role: Founder🔹Tecnología Digital aplicada a la Salud

json.company: Colegio de Ingenieros de Caminos, Canales y Puertos
json.description: Damos soporte y consejo a compañeros Ingenieros de Caminos que quieran explorar otras salidas profesionales de su carrera, como es mi caso, en el mundo de la Innovacion
json.role: Experto en Red de Ayuda (EredA) de Caminos Madrid

json.description:
ACCIONA held its corporate volunteer program, in which employees became teachers for a day, leading workshops on sustainability for children aged 6 to 10. This year, 600 employees took part, teaching over 13,000 schoolchildren.

The ACCIONA volunteers visited over 100 schools and, for a few hours, told the students about the importance of sustainable development. In this fifth edition, the activities and games focused on the UN Sustainable Development Goals, particularly the four with which our employees are most familiar because of their work: efficient water management, renewable energy, resilient infrastructure, and combating climate change.

The main goal of Volunteer Day is to involve children with improving the environment through small everyday gestures and to raise their awareness about the active role they can play in achieving sustainable development. It also imbues the values of sustainability in our employees

json.name: World's first Large Scale 3D Printed Pedestrian Bridge. Alcobendas (Madrid, Spain)
json.description:
The city of Alcobendas in Spain has just unveiled the first ever 3D printed pedestrian bridge made entirely of concrete. Measuring 12 metres in length and 1.75 metres in width, the landmark structure represents a milestone in civil engineering, an industry which up until now has been reluctant to use additive manufacturing. The bridge was inaugurated earlier today by Alcobendas city officials in Castilla La Mancha Park.
Made up of 8 separate pieces that fit together, the architectural design of the walkway was implemented by the Institute of Advanced Architecture of Catalonia, and later constructed by ACCIONA, a Spanish civil engineering company. ACCIONA can now claim the renowned status of the first construction company in the world to execute a large scale civil engineering project using 3D printing.
The stunning walkway was designed through techniques of organic and biomimetic architecture, according to an official statement from the Alcobendas city council, and resembles naturally occurring forms found in the environment.

json.name: Concrete Large Scale 3D Printing Technology
json.description: ACCIONA is pushing hard innovation and is developing new technology to implement Concrete Large Scale 3D Printing technology in several markets, as Singular Architectural Constructions, Preservation of Historical & Cultural Heritage and Customized Urban Areas.

json.name: New Business Line based on Reality Capture Technology
json.description: Reality Capture Technology offers highly accurate 3D virtual reality content for the industrial, real estate, tourism and facility management sectors. Its ability to capture existing conditions and store them in a digital format allows to create a virtual immersive visit of a space, take real measurements and identify alternatives to optimize operating costs and calculate reforms and maintenance remotely, quickly and more reliably

json.name: LIFE+ RENEWATT: Renewable Energy integration and Energy Efficient Systems to reduce energy consumption in Waste Water Treatment Plants (WWTP)
json.description: RENEWATT Project has the final objective of reducing energy consuption throug different actions in WWTP, focusing the optimization in the biological reactor aireation process and introducing renewable energy as input source

json.name: Building of caisson-type mooring dolphins using fiber reinforced polymeric materials at El Rosario Port in Fuerteventura
json.description: ACCIONA has developed and patented a construction system which minimizes the environmental impact and reduces the resources needed in the building of port infrastructure. Its composite material caissons are made from glass fiber combined with polymeric resins and replace conventionally-made concrete forms. The construction system has been implemented as a pioneering solution in works to extend mooring points on cruise ship wharfs at El Rosario Port in Fuerteventura, Canary Islands, developed by Las Palmas Port Authority: engineering, construction and location. ACCIONA’s solution can, by its nature, be applied to the performance and extension of any such quays, seawalls and mooring points in ports. It has significant environmental and operational advantages with respect to the concrete caissons used up to now.

json.name: Construction of Cuenca Carbon Fiber Stress-Ribbon Pedestrian Bridge
json.description: The Cuenca Carbon Fiber Stress-Ribbon Footbridge, across the Jucar River, is located in Cuenca, Spain. It is owned by Cuenca City and it was designed and constructed by ACCIONA. This bridge was completed and opened to the public in 2011. The Cuenca Stress-Ribbon Footbridge is a stress ribbon bridge with three spans (72 m × 3 m). The bridge width is 3 m and the total length is 216 m, which makes it become the longest stressed ribbon bridge in Spain and the eighth in the world. This bridge has two concrete piers, whose heights are 21.6 m and 16.98 m, respectively. The bridge decks are steel reinforced concrete slabs with the dimension of 3 m × 3.5 m and the stress ribbon supporting them consists of 16 CFRP cables. These CFRP cables were divided into four groups in transverse direction and fixed under the concrete slabs. Longitudinally, the stress ribbon was divided into five sections, and each section is a CFRP cable with a length of 43.7 m and a diameter of 41 mm. These CFRP cables were connected by an “8” shaped pin connection with each other.

json.name: Construction of Almuñecar Carbon Fiber Pedestrian Bridge (Madrid)
json.description: Almuñécar footbridge was built in Madrid in 2010 to substitute an old reinforced concrete footbridge crossing the Manzanares river. It has a span of 44 m, a width of 3.5 m and it is formed by a single FRP girder of 230 kN with a linear piece-wise axis and an inverted “Ω” cross section. The girder, completely made of carbon fibre, presents a series of longitudinal and transversal stiffeners to be able to accomplish with the challenging architectural requirements: a girder with a depth not greater than 1.20 m and with its inner surface completely covered with prefabricated reinforced concrete slabs.

json.name: Advanced concrete technologies implementation in shell footbridges over Madrid river in MRio Project
json.description: Two shell footbridges for the MRio (Madrid river) has been built by ACCIONA Infraestructuras. These footbriges are characterized by a double curvature cover with 49.08 m span, and 43.46 m platform span. In this site, the ACCIONA R&D Department has implemented with great success two technologies of Advanced Materials: Application of self-compacting concrete in extreme conditions of temperature and quick formwork removal structures applying the concrete maturity control technology, both technologies developed in the ACCIONA R&D Technological Center in Madrid.

json.name: Development and experimentation of the MLG system (Light Rail Transit of Granada): First spanish slab track system embedded in concrete performed with a mixture of rubber from scrap tires and resins with polymeric matrix
json.description: During the construction of the project U.T.E Campus de la Salud Armilla (Granada) ACCIONA has developed and applied successfully in a test pilot of eight hundred meters of simple track a new slab track railway system using rubber from scrap tires and resins with polymeric matrix, which it allows to reduce the high environmental impact caused by the landfills of used tires, distinguishing a high level of airborne noise, a key parameter in an urban railway system, due to presence of closed buildings.

json.name: Recycling of slurry type material from the excavation of retaining walls in the enlargement of the airfield at Malaga Airport
json.description: During the construction of the project “Ampliación del Campo de Vuelos del Aeropuerto de Málaga”, ACCIONA has developed and applied successfully a technology that allows to recycle the mud produced during the excavation works for making concrete diaphragm walls. Applying this technology we reach different goals: we can recycle the mud produced and use it to build the embankment of the landing strip of the airport, avoiding the strong environmental problems that produces mud dumps, reduce the traffic of soil transport vehicles around the site and also we decrease the emission of CO2 gases to the atmosphere because of the reduction of travels between the site and the mud dum.

json.name: Construction of two FRP bridges in M-111 Highway (Madrid)
json.description: These two bridges are located on the outskirts of Madrid along the M111 freeway and were built in 2007. These two bridges are identical, made up of three simple supported 14m span of 4 FRP girders each.

json.name: Extension Works of 11th Metro Line from Pan Bendito to Carabanchel Alto (Madrid)
json.description: - From 2005 to 2007: Site Work General Manager of "Extension Works of 11th Metro Line from Pan Bendito to Carabanchel Alto (Madrid)" Project for MINTRA, company that belongs to COMUNIDAD DE MADRID. Budget: 103.279.732 €.

json.name: Development of an innovative lime treatment applied to the materials bored with a Tunneling Boring Machine (TBM) used in enlargement of Subway Line 11 Project (Madrid)
json.description:
This project, submitted in the context of the policy of respect towards the environment shown throughout the duration of the Expansion Works of the Madrid Metro Transit Network, refers to the treatment applied to the materials extracted during the excavation works done by the TBM "Excavolina" in Line 11 of the Madrid Metro, carried out by MINTRA (Madrid Infraestructura del Transporte) in the Autonomous Community of Madrid with Dragados acting as Contracton In arder to be able to work under pressure, a prerequisite for all works done in urban environments such as the city of Madrid, it is essential to turn the materials produced at the front end at such high rates that the fill materials turras practically into sludge (material in a liquid state). Transporting tisis material in trucks through urban thoroughfares causes cleaning problems. The real issue, however, arises when taking these materials to the dumpsite, since their fluid nature malees their disposal and drying up difficult, needing large dumping surfaces to alternate load dumping while the drying process takes place.
The study carried out verifies that said material, when containing slightly to somewhat clayish sands having low-medium plasticity, can be treated with dehydrated lime (quicklime) in dosages of 1-2% by weight in the same working pit, producing in a few hours a material that is completely different and can be used as embankment fill in other infrastructures, having an acceptable quality that is equivalent to tolerable I suitable soils.
The results obtained are not good if the raw material is highly plasticity grey clay (locally known as "peñuela").

json.name: Extension of Airstrip of Torrejon Air Military Base and other complementary works
json.description: - From 2004 to 2005: Site Work General Manager of "Extension of Airstrip of Torrejon Air Military Base and other complementary works" Project for AENA. Budget: 61.498.750 €.

json.name: Construction of New Torrejon Road Link with A-2 Highway
json.description: - 2003: Site Work General Manager of "Construction of New Torrejon Road Link with A-2 Highway" Project for HENARSA (Autopistas del Henares S.A.) and MINISTERIO DE FOMENTO, during Radial 2 Project. Budget: 5.241.000 €.

json.name: Radial 2 Highway. Madrid M-50 - Guadalajara
json.description: - From 2001 to 2003: Site Work Production Manager. Bridges Area during the construction of Radial 2 Highway for HENARSA (Autopistas del Henares S.A.) and MINISTERIO DE FOMENTO. Section 2 Madrid M-50 - Guadalajara. When the project finished I became Site Work General Manager of UTE Radial 2 Project. Budget: 246.452.365 €.

json.name: Underground Hydroelectrical Power Plant of Millares II
json.description: - 2000: Site Work Technical Manager at "Underground Hydroelectrical Power Plant of Millares II" Project for IBERDROLA. Budget: 15.246.589 €.

json.name: Acceso Sur a Terra Mítica Project from A-7 Highway to Terra Mítica Amusement Park and "Red Viaria Peatonal de Terra Mítica
json.description: - 1999: Site Work Production Manager at "Acceso Sur a Terra Mítica, Enlace" Project from A-7 Highway to Terra Mítica Amusement Park and "Red Viaria Peatonal de Terra Mítica" Project for SPTA (Sociedad Parque Temático Alicante).

json.name: Acciona Smart Home. Viviendas Inteligentes Acciona Inmobiliaria
json.description:
ACCIONA da un paso más en la innovación con sus Smarthomes.
Comodidad, sencillez y ecoeficiencia para que disfrutes de tu hogar con los que más quieres.

json.name: First 5G Music Festival. 4K 360º Video streaming trasmitted to inmersive headsets in Cruilla Music Festival (Barcelona)
json.description:
Cruïlla has become one of the first worldwide test banks of 5G technology applied to the entertainment and live music industry thanks to Mobile World Capital Barcelona, ​​Cellnex Telecom, ACCIONA, MASMOVIL and Qwilt, in the framework of the 5G Barcelona initiative. The festival took place between 3 and 6 July at the Parc del Fòrum in Barcelona.

Thanks to this initiative, attendees to the tenth edition of the festival have been able to experience what it feels like to enjoy live a concert from the stage, alongside their favorite artists, through an immersive 360º virtual reality experience.

Links: 
- La Razón: Realidad Virtual en concierto. https://www.larazon.es/sociedad/medio-ambiente/realidad-virtual-en-concierto-JG24221679
- MWC: Cruïlla Barcelona presume de ser el primer festival 5G de Europa. https://www.mobileworldlive.com/spanish/cruilla-barcelona-presume-de-ser-el-primer-festival-5g-de-europa/
- El Confidencial: Cuatro días en el primer festival 5G: así es ver a Love of Lesbian en realidad virtual. https://www.elconfidencial.com/tecnologia/2019-07-15/festival-cruilla-barcelona-5g-realidad-virtual-bra_2111895/
- Timeout: Així és la tecnologia 5G que et porta dalt de l'escenari del Cruïlla. https://www.timeout.cat/barcelona/ca/noticies/aixi-es-la-tecnologia-5g-que-et-porta-dalt-de-lescenari-del-cruilla-070619

json.name: Virtual Reality Event in Acciona Shareholders Meeting. 360º Video shown on 350 Oculus Go VR glasses
json.description:
On April of 2019, we received a commitment from our Board to use the most innovative Virtual Reality technology in Acciona 2019 Shareholders Annual Meeting.
The first challenge was to be able to record a 360º video in more than five countries all around the world of most important Acciona projects. The second challenge was to install a launcher system of 360º video simultaneously during Acciona Shareholders meeting in 350 Oculus Go Virtual Reality glasses.
The result was amazing as we achieve the goal due to the excellent collaboration between our partners, Virtual Voyagers, and our Acciona colleagues of IT and Acciona Producciones y Diseño.

json.name: Spain’s National Archaeological Museum and Acciona Presented The First Romanesque Arch Printed in 3D
json.description:
Spain's National Archaeological Museum (MAN) and ACCIONA presented today in Madrid the first architectural item of cultural heritage to be reproduced full-scale by means of 3D printing in concrete. It is a replica of the San Pedro de las Dueñas Arch, the original of which is part of the Museum's collection. As of today, the replica is located in the garden at the National Archaeological Museum.
This technological milestone is the result of a collaboration agreement between the National Archaeological Museum and ACCIONA with the aim of applying cutting-edge techniques that contribute to raising awareness and preserving Spain's historical heritage.

json.name: First Micro Concrete Large Scale 3D Printed Pedestrian Bridge in Alcobendas (Madrid, Spain)
json.description:
The city of Alcobendas in Spain has just unveiled the first ever 3D printed pedestrian bridge made of concrete. Measuring 12 metres in length and 1.75 metres in width, the landmark structure represents a milestone in civil engineering, an industry which up until now has been reluctant to use additive manufacturing. The bridge was inaugurated on December of 2016 by Alcobendas city officials in Castilla La Mancha Park.
Made up of 8 separate pieces that fit together, the architectural design of the walkway was implemented by the Institute of Advanced Architecture of Catalonia, and later constructed by Acciona, a Spanish civil engineering company. Acciona can now claim the renowned status of the first construction company in the world to execute a large scale civil engineering project using 3D printing.
The stunning walkway was designed through techniques of organic and biomimetic architecture, according to an official statement from the Alcobendas city council, and resembles naturally occurring forms found in the environment.
